OGMS:0000063.definition: The totality of all processes through which a given disease instance is realized.
OGMS:0000063.label: disease course

IDO:0000084.definition: 'GO:nthe specific processes that generate the ability of an organism to cause disease in anothernnnThis is defined in GO so import.'-ID[O]:0000084: GO:nthe specific processes that generate the ability of an organism to cause disease in anothernnnThis is defined in GO so import.
IDO:0000084.label: _obsolete_pathogenesis

GO:0000003.definition: The production of new individuals that contain some portion of genetic material inherited from one or more parent organisms.
GO:0000003.label: reproduction

IDO:0000635.definition: A role borne by a material entity in virtue of the fact that it contains a site from which an infectious agent is transmitted.
IDO:0000635.label: source of infection role

IDO:0000636.definition: A process that is a systemic inflammatory response to infection.
IDO:0000636.label: sepsis

IDO:0000637.definition: A sepsis that results in organ dysfunction, hypotension, or hypofusion of at least one organ.
IDO:0000637.label: severe sepsis

IDO:0000630.definition: An infection resulting from a transmission process that unfolds in a hospital.
IDO:0000630.label: hospital-acquired infection

IDO:0000631.definition: An infection resulting from a transmission process that did not unfold in a health care facility.
IDO:0000631.label: community-acquired infection

IDO:0000632.definition: A molecular entity with a toxin disposition, the realization of which damages or interferes with the function of nerve tissue.
IDO:0000632.label: neurotoxin

IDO:0000633.definition: An infection established as a result of spread from another infection in a non-adjacent location in the extended organism of the host.
IDO:0000633.label: metatstatic infection

IDO:0000638.definition: An infection resulting from a transmission process that unfolds in a nursing home.
IDO:0000638.label: nursing-home acquired infection

IDO:0000639.definition: An infectious agent with a capability to infect human hosts.
IDO:0000639.label: infectious human pathogen

CARO:0000000.definition: A part of a multicellular organism that is either an immaterial entity or a material entity with granularity above the level of a protein complex.  Or, a substance produced by a multicellular organism with granularity above the level of a protein complex.
CARO:0000000.label: anatomical entity

BFO:0000004.definition: A continuant that is a bearer of quality and realizable entity entities, in which other entities inhere and which itself cannot inhere in anything.
BFO:0000004.label: independent continuant

BFO:0000005.definition: A continuant  that is either dependent on one or other independent continuant  bearers or inheres in or is borne by other entities.
BFO:0000005.label: obsolete dependent continuant

BFO:0000002.definition: An entity that exists in full at any time in which it exists at all, persists through time while maintaining its identity and has no temporal parts.
BFO:0000002.label: continuant

BFO:0000003.definition: An entity that has temporal parts and that happens, unfolds or develops through time.
BFO:0000003.label: occurrent

IDO:0000447.definition: A collective resistance disposition that inheres in an organism population in virtue of the fact that the proportion of the population with immunity to an infectious agent is high resulting in a low number of transmissions from hosts in the population to susceptible individuals in the population and thereby mitigating the damaging effects of the infectious agent on the population.
IDO:0000447.label: herd immunity to infectious organism

IDO:0000446.definition: A protective resistance that inheres in an organism and mitigates the damaging effects on that organism of an infectious agent.
IDO:0000446.label: resistance to infectious agent

IDO:0000445.definition: A protective resistance that mitigates the damaging effects of a drug.
IDO:0000445.label: resistance to drug

IDO:0000444.definition: A disposition that inheres in a material entity in virtue of the fact that the entity has a part (e.g. a gene product), which itself has a disposition to mitigate damage to the entity.
IDO:0000444.label: protective resistance

IDO:0000443.definition: A disposition to kill or inhibit the development or reproduction of eukaryotic parasites.
IDO:0000443.label: antiparasitic disposition

IDO:0000442.definition: A disposition to kill or inhibit the reproduction of bacteria.
IDO:0000442.label: antibacterial disposition

IDO:0000441.definition: A disposition to kill or inhibit the development or reproduction of fungal organisms.
IDO:0000441.label: antifungal disposition

IDO:0000440.definition: A disposition to kill or inhibit the lifecycle of viruses.
IDO:0000440.label: antiviral disposition

IDO:0000520.definition: A continuous temporal interval during which an infectious agent host bears a contagiousness disposition.
IDO:0000520.label: communicability period

IDO:0000522.definition: An organism bearing a symbiont role.
IDO:0000522.label: symbiont

IDO:0000523.definition: An organism that can only reach developmental maturity, replicate, or persist in symbiosis.
IDO:0000523.label: obligatory symbiont

IDO:0000524.definition: An organism bearing a mutualist role.
IDO:0000524.label: mutualist

IDO:0000525.definition: An organism bearing a commensal role.
IDO:0000525.label: commensal

IDO:0000449.definition: An immunity to infectious agent that results in elimination of the infectious agent from the host.
IDO:0000449.label: sterilizing immunity to infectious agent

IDO:0000448.definition: A resistance to infectious agent that inheres in an organism in virtue of immune system components in the extended organism.
IDO:0000448.label: immunity to infectious agent

IDO:0000219.definition: 'agent is incubated?ndisease is incubated?'-ID[O]:0000219: agent is incubated?ndisease is incubated?
IDO:0000219.label: _obsolete_incubation period

OGMS:0000020.definition: A quality of a patient that is observed by the patient or a processual entity experienced by the patient, either of which is hypothesized by the patient to be a realization of a disease.
OGMS:0000020.label: symptom

GO:0019815.definition: An immunoglobulin complex that is present in the plasma membrane of B cells and that in its canonical form is composed of two identical immunoglobulin heavy chains and two identical immunoglobulin light chains and a signaling subunit, a heterodimer of the Ig-alpha and Ig-beta proteins.
GO:0019815.label: B cell receptor complex

GO:0019814.definition: A protein complex that in its canonical form is composed of two identical immunoglobulin heavy chains and two identical immunoglobulin light chains, held together by disulfide bonds and sometimes complexed with additional proteins. An immunoglobulin complex may be embedded in the plasma membrane or present in the extracellular space, in mucosal areas or other tissues, or circulating in the blood or lymph.
GO:0019814.label: immunoglobulin complex

IDO:0000060.definition: 'inanimate holder, is water a fomite or only a reservoir?'-ID[O]:0000060: inanimate holder, is water a fomite or only a reservoir?
IDO:0000060.label: _obsolete_fomite

IDO:0000063.definition: 'holder and a carrier (actively transmits) and living: potentially make a cross product.  every vector comes into contact with the target. (from one host to another?)'-ID[O]:0000063: holder and a carrier (actively transmits) and living: potentially make a cross product.  every vector comes into contact with the target. (from one host to another?)
IDO:0000063.label: _obsolete_vector

IDO:0001014.definition: A pathologically immunosuppressed organism that is a human experiencing drug-based immunosuppression.
IDO:0001014.label: immunosuppressed human experiencing drug-based immunosuppression due to organ transplant

IDO:0001013.definition: An immunosuppressed organism that is a human experiencing chronic systemic steroid use-based immunosuppression.
IDO:0001013.label: immunosuppressed human experiencing chronic systemic steroid use-based immunosuppression

IDO:0001012.definition: a pathologically immunosuppressed organism that is experiencing chronic systemic steroid use-based immunosuppression.
IDO:0001012.label: immunosuppressed organism experiencing chronic systemic steroid use-based immunosuppression

IDO:0001011.definition: A pathologically immunosuppressed organism that is experiencing drug-based immunosuppression.
IDO:0001011.label: immunosuppressed organism experiencing drug-based immunosuppression

IDO:0001010.definition: A drug-based immunosuppression process that results from chronic systemic steroid use.
IDO:0001010.label: chronic systemic steroid use-based immunosuppression

IDO:0000519.definition: A continuous temporal interval beginning with the extablishment of an infectious agent colony and ending with the onset of symptoms (or infectious disease course?).
IDO:0000519.label: incubation period

IDO:0000483.definition: A quality that inheres in an organism population and is the infectious disease incidence proportion per unit time.
IDO:0000483.label: infectious disease incidence rate

IDO:0000482.definition: A quality that inheres in an organism population and is the proportion of members of the population not infected at the beginning of a specified period of time who become infected during the specified period of time.
IDO:0000482.label: infection incidence proportion

IDO:0000481.definition: A quality that inheres in an organism population and is the proportion of members of the population not experiencing an infectious disease course at the beginning of a specified period of time and in whom the infectious disease begins during the specified period of time.
IDO:0000481.label: infectious disease incidence proportion

IDO:0000480.definition: A quality that inheres in an organism population and is the number of organisms in the population that become infected with an infectious agent during a specified period of time.
IDO:0000480.label: infection incidence

IDO:0000487.definition: A quality that inheres in an organism population and is the number of organisms in the population who have, at any point during their lives, been bearers of an infectious disease and experienced realization of the disease.
IDO:0000487.label: infectious disease lifetime prevalence

IDO:0000486.definition: A quality that inheres in an organism population and is the number of organisms in the population infected with an infectious agent at a specified time.
IDO:0000486.label: infection prevalence

IDO:0000485.definition: A quality that inheres in an organism population and is the number of realizations of an infectious disease in the population at a specified time.
IDO:0000485.label: infectious disease prevalence

IDO:0000484.definition: A quality that inheres in an organism population and is the infection incidence proportion per unit time.
IDO:0000484.label: infection incidence rate

IDO:0000489.definition: A quality that inheres in an organism population and is the per capita number of deaths in the population resulting from an infectious disease over a specified period of time.
IDO:0000489.label: infectious disease mortality rate

IDO:0000488.definition: A quality that inheres in an organism population and is the number of organisms in the population that have antibody specific for an infectious agent in their serum at a specified time.
IDO:0000488.label: infectious agent seroprevalence

IDO:0000564.definition: A material entity with an antiviral disposition that is realized in a process of killing viruses.
IDO:0000564.label: viricide

IDO:0000565.definition: A material entity with an antimicrobial disposition that is realized in a process of inhibiting the growth of microorganisms.
IDO:0000565.label: microbistatic

IDO:0000566.definition: An infection bearing the primary infection role.
IDO:0000566.label: primary infection

IDO:0000567.definition: An infection bearing the secondary infection role.
IDO:0000567.label: secondary infection

IDO:0000649.definition: An infection located in the colon and that has as part organisms of the Species Entamoeba histolytica
IDO:0000649.label: amebiasis

IDO:0000648.definition: An infection located in the bowel and that has as part organisms of the Genus Shigella.
IDO:0000648.label: Shigellosis

IDO:0000562.definition: A material entity bearing an antibacterial disposition.
IDO:0000562.label: antibacterial

IDO:0000563.definition: A material entity with an antimicrobial disposition that is realized in a process of killing microorganisms.
IDO:0000563.label: microbicide

IDO:0000645.definition: An infection that has as part organisms of the Genus Candida.
IDO:0000645.label: candidiasis

IDO:0000644.definition: An immunosuppression induced by progesterone and other factors upregulated in pregnant women.
IDO:0000644.label: pregnancy-induced immunosuppression

IDO:0000647.definition: An infection that has as part organisms of the Genus Leptospira.
IDO:0000647.label: leptospirosis

IDO:0000646.definition: An infection that has as part organisms of the Species Trichomonas vaginalis.
IDO:0000646.label: trichomoniasis

IDO:0000568.definition: An infectious disease that has as its physical basis an infectious disorder composed of infectious agents that have a zoonotic disposition.
IDO:0000568.label: zoonosis

IDO:0000640.definition: An immunodeficiency that is not caused by a genetic predisposition.
IDO:0000640.label: acquired immunodeficiency

IDO:0000643.definition: An infectious agent whose infection incidence is increasing in a host population as a result of changes in the biology of the host or pathogen, or changes in their interactions.
IDO:0000643.label: re-emerging pathogen

IDO:0000642.definition: An infection comprised of infectious organisms all of the same Species.
IDO:0000642.label: simple infection

GO:0045087.definition: Innate immune responses are defense responses mediated by germline encoded components that directly recognize components of potential pathogens.
GO:0045087.label: innate immune response

IDO:0000209.definition: 'quality [state] of an organism that during its life cycle in which its growth. development, metabolism, etc is temporarily suspended nnnsuspended state, non-replicative state, resting state'-ID[O]:0000209: quality [state] of an organism that during its life cycle in which its growth. development, metabolism, etc is temporarily suspended nnnsuspended state, non-replicative state, resting state
IDO:0000209.label: _obsolete_dormancy

IDO:0000208.definition: 'prevalence as measured by antibody'-ID[O]:0000208: prevalence as measured by antibody
IDO:0000208.label: _obsolete_seroprevalence

IDO:0000205.definition: 'the process by which a biotic entity establishes multiple copies of itself in a new environment (including an organismal environment).nnfix idn"native" environment term'-ID[O]:0000205: the process by which a biotic entity establishes multiple copies of itself in a new environment (including an organismal environment).nnfix idn"native" environment term
IDO:0000205.label: _obsolete_colonization

IDO:0000511.definition: An organism population whose members have an infection.
IDO:0000511.label: infected population

BFO:0000035.definition: p is a process boundary =Def. p is a temporal part of a process & p has no proper temporal parts. (axiom label in BFO2 Reference: [084-001])
BFO:0000035.label: process boundary

BFO:0000031.definition: b is a generically dependent continuant = Def. b is a continuant that g-depends_on one or more other entities. (axiom label in BFO2 Reference: [074-001])
BFO:0000031.label: generically dependent continuant

IDO:0000418.definition: An infectious agent transporter role that is borne by an organism active in the transfer of an infectious agent to an organism of another Species and in which the agent is infectious.
IDO:0000418.label: infectious agent vector role

IDO:0000419.definition: An infectious agent vector role borne by an organism in virtue of the fact that the infectious agent does not multiply in or on the vector.
IDO:0000419.label: mechanical vector of infectious agent role

IDO:0000410.definition: A symbiont host role borne by an organism in virtue of the fact that its partner in symbiosis utilizes the host to undergo a developmental stage transition, and the host is required for continuation of the partner's life cycle.
IDO:0000410.label: intermediate host role

IDO:0000411.definition: A symbiont host role borne by an organism in virtue of the fact that its partner in symbiosis utilizes the host to undergo a developmental stage transition, but the host is not required for continuation of the partner's life cycle.
IDO:0000411.label: paratenic host role

IDO:0000412.definition: A symbiont host role borne by an organism in virtue of the fact that its partner in symbiosis has the infectious disposition but cannot be transmitted from the host to the partner's definitive host.
IDO:0000412.label: dead-end host role

IDO:0000413.definition: A symbiont host role borne by an organism in virtue of the fact that its partner in symbiosis derives from the host a growth, survival, or fitness advantage while the host's growth, survival, or fitness is reduced.
IDO:0000413.label: parasite host role

IDO:0000414.definition: A pathogen host role borne by an organism in virtue of the fact that its extended organism contains an infectious agent.
IDO:0000414.label: infectious agent host role

IDO:0000415.definition: A host role borne by an organism in virtue of the fact that its extended organism contains a pathogen.
IDO:0000415.label: pathogen host role

IDO:0000416.definition: An infectious agent host role borne by an organism in virtue of the fact that its extended organism contains an infectious agent, the infectious agent has the infectious disposition towards the host, and the host has no symptoms of the infectious disease caused by the infectious agent.
IDO:0000416.label: infectious agent carrier role

IDO:0000417.definition: A role borne by a material entity in virtue of the fact that an infectious agent is located in or on the entity and the entity has the capability to transfer (either actively or passively) the infectious agent from one location to another.
IDO:0000417.label: infectious agent transporter role

IDO:0000025.definition: 'the ability of the biotic entity to cause disease in a host of a given typenndo we need to say damage instead of disease?nnpathogenicity and virulence are used as synonyms in some communities'-ID[O]:0000025: the ability of the biotic entity to cause disease in a host of a given typenndo we need to say damage instead of disease?nnpathogenicity and virulence are used as synonyms in some communities
IDO:0000025.label: _obsolete_pathogenicity

IDO:0000029.definition: 'number of new cases in a given period of time'-ID[O]:0000029: number of new cases in a given period of time
IDO:0000029.label: _obsolete_incidence

BFO:0000140.definition: b is a continuant fiat boundary = Def. b is an immaterial entity that is of zero, one or two dimensions and does not include a spatial region as part. (axiom label in BFO2 Reference: [029-001])
BFO:0000140.label: continuant fiat boundary

BFO:0000145.definition: b is a relational quality = Def. for some independent continuants c, d and for some time t: b quality_of c at t & b quality_of d at t. (axiom label in BFO2 Reference: [057-001])
BFO:0000145.label: relational quality

BFO:0000144.definition: b is a process_profile =Def. there is some process c such that b process_profile_of c (axiom label in BFO2 Reference: [093-002])
BFO:0000144.label: process profile

IDO:0000560.definition: A material entity bearing an antifungal disposition.
IDO:0000560.label: antifungal

IDO:0000561.definition: A material entity bearing an antiparasitic disposition.
IDO:0000561.label: antiparasitic

IAO:0000409.definition: A denotator type indicates how a term should be interpreted from an ontological perspective.
IAO:0000409.label: denotator type

GO:0051704.definition: A biological process which involves another organism of the same or different species.
GO:0051704.label: multi-organism process

IDO:0000569.definition: An organism that is host to an infectious agent and has no symptoms of the infectious disease associated with the infectious agent.
IDO:0000569.label: asymptomatic host of infectious agent

IDO:0000609.definition: A colonization of human process in which the colonized site is the anterior nares.
IDO:0000609.label: colonization of human anterior nares

IDO:0000608.definition: A production process in which a participant creates a copy of itself.
IDO:0000608.label: replication

IDO:0000601.definition: A host exposure to environment with infectious agent where the environment contains an infectious agent vector.
IDO:0000601.label: host coming into contact with vector of infectious agent

IDO:0000600.definition: A host exposure to environment with infectious agent where the exposure is accidental; the environment is a laboratory, and the infectious agent is infectious in humans.
IDO:0000600.label: release of infectious human pathogen in laboratory

IDO:0000603.definition: A process by which an infectious agent, established in a host, becomes part of an infection in the host.
IDO:0000603.label: process of establishing an infection

IDO:0000602.definition: A host exposure to environment with infectious agent where the environment contains a material entity that has been assessed to confer a risk of infection.
IDO:0000602.label: host exposure to substance that might have infectious agent

IDO:0000605.definition: A biological object or group of biological objects in close spatial proximity.
IDO:0000605.label: _obsolete_biological object colony

IDO:0000604.definition: An establishment of localization in host process in which an organism establishes itself in a host.
IDO:0000604.label: colonization of host

IDO:0000607.definition: A process in which an entity comes into being as a result of the process.
IDO:0000607.label: production

IDO:0000606.definition: A colonization of host process that results in a clinically abnormal colony.
IDO:0000606.label: establishment of a clinically abnormal colony

GO:0085030.definition: An interaction between two organisms living together in more or less intimate association in a relationship in which both organisms benefit from each other.
GO:0085030.label: mutualism

GO:0085031.definition: An interaction between two organisms living together in more or less intimate association in a relationship in which one benefits and the other is unaffected.
GO:0085031.label: commensalism

GO:0051234.definition: Any process that localizes a substance or cellular component. This may occur via movement, tethering or selective degradation.
GO:0051234.label: establishment of localization

IDO:0000454.definition: An infectious disposition that is the disposition to be transmitted from an infected, human host to a non-human host.
IDO:0000454.label: reverse zoonotic disposition

IDO:0000455.definition: A disposition that inheres in a collection of entities in virtue of the individual dispositions of the constituents of that collection.
IDO:0000455.label: collective disposition

IDO:0000456.definition: An organism that is experiencing pregnancy-induced or pathologic immunosuppression.
IDO:0000456.label: immunosuppressed organism

IDO:0000450.definition: A disposition to initiate processes that result in a disorder.
IDO:0000450.label: pathogenic disposition

IDO:0000451.definition: A disposition borne by an infectious agent that is the disposition to penetrate the epithelial barriers of an organism of another Species.
IDO:0000451.label: invasive disposition

IDO:0000452.definition: A pathogenic disposition that inheres in an organism and is a disposition for that organism (1) to be transmitted to a host, (2) to establish itself in the host, (3) to initiate processes that result in a disorder in the host, and (4) to become part of that disorder.
IDO:0000452.label: infectious disposition

IDO:0000453.definition: An infectious disposition that is the disposition to be transmitted from an infected, non-human host to a human host.
IDO:0000453.label: zoonotic disposition

IDO:0000515.definition: An organism population whose members are participating in non-parasitic symbiosis with a particular host.
IDO:0000515.label: normal resident microbiota population

IDO:0000514.definition: An organism population whose members are not infected with an infectious agent and who lack immunity to the infectious agent.
IDO:0000514.label: susceptible population

IDO:0000516.definition: An infectious organism population with a certain configuration quality (OGMS:0000039) (distributed across a spatial region (e.g., anatomical location in a host) in a particular way). Put e.g. In comments
IDO:0000516.label: _obsolete_configured infectious organism population

IDO:0000458.definition: A disposition that inheres in a host of infectious agent and is a disposition to transmit infectious agents to organisms of the same Species through casual contact with a high likelihood of realization.
IDO:0000458.label: contagiousness

IDO:0000459.definition: An organism that contains a colony in or on its extended organism.
IDO:0000459.label: colonized host

IDO:0000513.definition: An organism population whose members each have an infectious disposition.
IDO:0000513.label: infectious agent population

IDO:0000512.definition: An organism population in whose members an infectious disease is being realized.
IDO:0000512.label: diseased population

IDO:0000101.definition: 'the process by which an infectious disease establishes itself in a new population (or at a sufficiently higher rate? higher prevalence and/or higher incidence)'-ID[O]:0000101: the process by which an infectious disease establishes itself in a new population (or at a sufficiently higher rate? higher prevalence and/or higher incidence)
IDO:0000101.label: _obsolete_emergence

OGMS:0000031.definition: A disposition (i) to undergo pathological processes that (ii) exists in an organism because of one or more disorders in that organism.
OGMS:0000031.label: disease

IDO:0000074.definition: 'create cross products for "host" and "pathogen" that will be part of this process.'-ID[O]:0000074: create cross products for "host" and "pathogen" that will be part of this process.
IDO:0000074.label: _obsolete_pathogen adherence to host cell

IDO:0000204.definition: 'Role played by portion of physical substance in a biological process'-ID[O]:0000204: Role played by portion of physical substance in a biological process
IDO:0000204.label: _obsolete_factor

OGMS:0000045.definition: A material entity which is clinically abnormal and part of an extended organism. Disorders are the physical basis of disease.
OGMS:0000045.label: disorder

IDO:0001004.definition: An infection-based immunosuppression process which arises as the result of an HIV infection.
IDO:0001004.label: HIV-based immunosuppression

IDO:0001005.definition: An immunosuppressed organism that is experiencing pathologic immunosuppression.
IDO:0001005.label: pathologically immunosuppressed organism

IDO:0001006.definition: A pathologically immunosuppressed organism that is experiencing infection-based immunosuppression.
IDO:0001006.label: immunosuppressed organism experiencing infection-based immunosuppression

IDO:0001007.definition: A pathologically immunosuppressed organism that is experiencing HIV-based immunosuppression.
IDO:0001007.label: immunosuppressed organism experiencing HIV-based immunosuppression

IAO:0000225.definition: The reason for which a term has been deprecated. The allowed values come from an enumerated list of predefined terms. See the specification of these instances for more detailed definitions of each enumerated value.
IAO:0000225.label: obsolescence reason specification

IDO:0001002.definition: A process by which a part of an organism or something contained in an organism becomes clinically abnormal.
IDO:0001002.label: transition to clinical abnormality

IDO:0001003.definition: A pathologic immunosuppression process which arises as the result of an infection and is initiated or dysregulated by the infectious agent population.
IDO:0001003.label: infection-based immunosuppression

IDO:0001008.definition: An immunosuppressed organism that is a human experiencing HIV-based immunosuppression.
IDO:0001008.label: immunosuppressed human experiencing HIV-based immunosuppression

IDO:0001009.definition: A pathologic immunosuppression process which arises as the result of treatment with a drug that attenuates immune responses.
IDO:0001009.label: drug-based immunosuppression

IDO:0000083.definition: 'the process by which an infectious agent passes from one organism to another organism'-ID[O]:0000083: the process by which an infectious agent passes from one organism to another organism
IDO:0000083.label: _obsolete_transmission

GO:0048525.definition: Any process that stops, prevents, or reduces the frequency, rate or extent of a multi-organism process in which a virus is a participant.
GO:0048525.label: negative regulation of viral process

IDO:0000559.definition: A material entity bearing an antiviral disposition.
IDO:0000559.label: antiviral

IDO:0000491.definition: An infectious disease prevalence that is typical for an infectious disease in an organism population.
IDO:0000491.label: infectious disease endemic level

IDO:0000492.definition: An infectious disease incidence rate that is typical for an infectious disease in an organism population.
IDO:0000492.label: infectious disease endemic rate

IDO:0000493.definition: An infectious disease endemicity that inheres in an organism population in virtue of the fact that the infectious disease endemic level for an infectious disease is persistently high in the population.
IDO:0000493.label: infectious disease hyper-endemicity

IDO:0000494.definition: A quality that inheres in an organism population by virtue of the fact that realizations of an infectious disease occur in the population with a fluctuating prevalence.
IDO:0000494.label: infectious disease sporadicity

IDO:0000495.definition: A disease course that is the realization of an infectious disease.
IDO:0000495.label: infectious disease course

IDO:0000496.definition: A chronic infectious disease course that does not progress to severe stages for a long period of time.
IDO:0000496.label: long-term non-progressing infectious disease course

IDO:0000497.definition: A process by which an organism acquires immunity to an infectious agent.
IDO:0000497.label: immunization against infectious agent

IDO:0000551.definition: A molecular entity with an exotoxin disposition, the realization of which damages cells of the host intestinal mucosa.
IDO:0000551.label: enterotoxin

IDO:0000550.definition: A molecular entity bearing an exotoxin disposition.
IDO:0000550.label: exotoxin

IDO:0000553.definition: An anatomical entity bearing an infectious agent portal of entry role.
IDO:0000553.label: infectious agent portal of entry

IDO:0000552.definition: A molecular entity with a toxin disposition and that is a structural component of a pathogen and is released from the pathogen only upon cytolysis.
IDO:0000552.label: endotoxin

IDO:0000555.definition: A material entity bearing a disinfectant role.
IDO:0000555.label: disinfectant

IDO:0000554.definition: An anatomical entity bearing an infectious agent portal of exit role.
IDO:0000554.label: infectious agent portal of exit

IDO:0000557.definition: A biological macromolecule that has an adhesion disposition.
IDO:0000557.label: adhesion factor

IDO:0000556.definition: A material entity bearing an antiseptic role.
IDO:0000556.label: antiseptic

IDO:0000652.definition: A colonization of human process in which the colonized site is a perineum.
IDO:0000652.label: colonization of human perineum

IDO:0000653.definition: An infectious disease that has as its physical basis an infectious disorder composed of infectious agents that have a reverse zoonotic disposition.
IDO:0000653.label: reverse zoonosis

IDO:0000650.definition: A colonization of host process in which the host is of Species Homo sapiens.
IDO:0000650.label: colonization of human

IDO:0000651.definition: An immunodeficiency that exists in an organism because of a genetic predisposition.
IDO:0000651.label: primary immunodeficiency

IDO:0000656.definition: A pathogen transmission process in which a pathogen is transmitted from one host to another of the same Species, and the two hosts are not in a parent-child relationship.
IDO:0000656.label: horizontal pathogen transmission process

IDO:0000657.definition: A process that results in death.
IDO:0000657.label: process that results in death

IDO:0000654.definition: An infectious agent with an opportunistic infectious disposition.
IDO:0000654.label: opportunistic pathogen

IDO:0000655.definition: A disposition to undergo a transmission process.
IDO:0000655.label: transmissibility disposition

GO:0044403.definition: An interaction between two organisms living together in more or less intimate association. Microscopic symbionts are often referred to as endosymbionts. The various forms of symbiosis include parasitism, in which the association is disadvantageous or destructive to one of the organisms; mutualism, in which the association is advantageous, or often necessary to one or both and not harmful to either; and commensalism, in which one member of the association benefits while the other is not affected. However, mutualism, parasitism, and commensalism are often not discrete categories of interactions and should rather be perceived as a continuum of interaction ranging from parasitism to mutualism. In fact, the direction of a symbiotic interaction can change during the lifetime of the symbionts due to developmental changes as well as changes in the biotic/abiotic environment in which the interaction occurs.
GO:0044403.label: symbiosis, encompassing mutualism through parasitism

IDO:0000658.definition: A process in which a potential host of an infectious agent is exposed to an infectious agent.
IDO:0000658.label: host exposure to infectious agent

IDO:0000659.definition: An organism that is not infected with an infectious agent and lacks protective immunity to the infectious agent.
IDO:0000659.label: susceptible organism

GO:0044406.definition: The attachment of a symbiont to its host via adhesion molecules, general stickiness etc., either directly or indirectly. The host is defined as the larger of the organisms involved in a symbiotic interaction.
GO:0044406.label: adhesion of symbiont to host

CL:0000000.definition: A material entity of anatomical origin (part of or deriving from an organism) that has as its parts a maximally connected cell compartment surrounded by a plasma membrane.
CL:0000000.label: cell

CL:0000738.definition: An achromatic cell of the myeloid or lymphoid lineages capable of ameboid movement, found in blood or other tissue.
CL:0000738.label: leukocyte

IDO:0000212.definition: 'can change depending on environmentnnwhere should susceptibility factors go?'-ID[O]:0000212: can change depending on environmentnnwhere should susceptibility factors go?
IDO:0000212.label: _obsolete_susceptibility

IDO:0000528.definition: A material entity with a pathogenic disposition.
IDO:0000528.label: pathogen

BFO:0000020.definition: A continuant that inheres in or is borne by other entities. Every instance of A requires some specific instance of B which must always be the same.
BFO:0000020.label: specifically dependent continuant

BFO:0000023.definition: A realizable entity  the manifestation of which brings about some result or end that is not essential to a continuant  in virtue of the kind of thing that it is but that can be served or participated in by that kind of continuant  in some kinds of natural, social or institutional contexts.
BFO:0000023.label: role

IDO:0000429.definition: A toxin disposition that inheres in a protein or protein complex that is a structural component of a pathogen and is released from the pathogen only upon cytolysis.
IDO:0000429.label: endotoxin disposition

IDO:0000428.definition: An exotoxin disposition to damage cells of the host intestinal mucosa.
IDO:0000428.label: enterotoxin disposition

IDO:0000425.definition: A disposition borne by a biological macromolecule produced by a pathogen that is a disposition to undergo processes that increase the pathogen's virulence.
IDO:0000425.label: virulence factor disposition

IDO:0000424.definition: A role borne by a material entity in virtue of the fact that it is a habitat in which infectious agents can persist and multiply and from which they can be transmitted in virtue of prevailing practices of potential hosts.
IDO:0000424.label: reservoir of infectious agent role

IDO:0000427.definition: A toxin disposition to damage cells or extracellular matrix by a direct enzymatic process.
IDO:0000427.label: exotoxin disposition

IDO:0000426.definition: A disposition to cause I) malfunction of cells, ii) damage to extracellular matrix, or iii) damage of cells to a degree that can result in cell death.
IDO:0000426.label: toxin disposition

IDO:0000421.definition: An infectious agent transporter role borne by an entity in virtue of the fact that the entity is not a complete organism.
IDO:0000421.label: infectious agent vehicle role

IDO:0000420.definition: An infectious agent vector role borne by an organism in virtue of the fact that the infectious agent multiplies in the vector.
IDO:0000420.label: biological vector of infectious agent role

IDO:0000423.definition: An infectious agent vehicle role borne by an entity in virtue of the fact that the entity is not alive.
IDO:0000423.label: fomite role

IDO:0000422.definition: An infectious agent vehicle role borne by an entity in virtue of the fact that the entity is living or contains living cells other than those that have the infectious disposition.
IDO:0000422.label: biological vehicle of infectious agent role

IDO:0000526.definition: A organism bearing a parasite role.
IDO:0000526.label: parasite

IDO:0000527.definition: An infectious agent that is an organism.
IDO:0000527.label: _obsolete_infectious organism

IDO:0000040.definition: 'role played by a portion of substance to promote virulencennmagnitudendegree of pathogenesis'-ID[O]:0000040: role played by a portion of substance to promote virulencennmagnitudendegree of pathogenesis
IDO:0000040.label: _obsolete_virulence factor

IDO:0000048.definition: 'look at mathias's ontology of cancer to get all the subterms...its under quality there'-ID[O]:0000048: look at mathias's ontology of cancer to get all the subterms...its under quality there
IDO:0000048.label: _obsolete_symptom

GO:0006955.definition: Any immune system process that functions in the calibrated response of an organism to a potential internal or invasive threat.
GO:0006955.label: immune response

GO:0006959.definition: An immune response mediated through a body fluid.
GO:0006959.label: humoral immune response

IDO:0000595.definition: An organism that has the capability to bear a host of infectious agent role.
IDO:0000595.label: potential host of infectious agent

IDO:0000594.definition: A process in which a potential host of an infectious agent comes into direct physical contact with the infectious agent.
IDO:0000594.label: direct host exposure to infectious agent

IDO:0000597.definition: A process in which a potential host of an infectious agent is exposed to an environment in which the infectious agent is present and physical contact between the two can occur, but such contact is not planned.
IDO:0000597.label: host exposure to environment containing infectious agent

IDO:0000596.definition: An organism that has an infectious disposition.
IDO:0000596.label: infectious agent

IDO:0000591.definition: An infectious disposition to be transmitted directly from one human host to another.
IDO:0000591.label: _obsolete_communicable disposition

IDO:0000590.definition: An infectious disease course that unfolds over a long period of time.
IDO:0000590.label: chronic infectious disease course

IDO:0000618.definition: A disposition that is the ability to mount a normal immune response.
IDO:0000618.label: immunocompetence

GO:0043093.definition: A cytokinesis process that involves a set of conserved proteins including FtsZ, and results in the formation of two similarly sized and shaped cells.
GO:0043093.label: FtsZ-dependent cytokinesis

IDO:0000616.definition: A colony whose members are infectious agents.
IDO:0000616.label: infectious agent colony

IDO:0000617.definition: A disorder of an immune system component that results in defective functioning of the immune system.
IDO:0000617.label: immunodeficiency

UBERON:0035944.definition: A life cycle temporal boundary that marks the end of the life cycle of the organism.
UBERON:0035944.label: life-death temporal boundary

IDO:0000615.definition: An organism population persisting in a site it has colonized.
IDO:0000615.label: colony

IDO:0000599.definition: A host exposure to environment with infectious agent where the environment is an area in which an infectious agent is endemic
IDO:0000599.label: host living in endemic area

IDO:0000598.definition: A host exposure to environment with infectious agent where the environment is a household that also has an infected host
IDO:0000598.label: host living with infected household contact

IDO:0000610.definition: A process that attenuates an immune response.
IDO:0000610.label: immunosuppression

IDO:0000611.definition: An immunosuppression which unfolds as part of the natural self-regulation of an immune response.
IDO:0000611.label: physiologic immunosuppression

IDO:0000619.definition: A disposition whose realization negatively regulates an immune response.
IDO:0000619.label: immunosuppressive disposition

IDO:0000469.definition: A susceptibility that is the degree to which an entity can be harmed or inhibited from surviving by a drug.
IDO:0000469.label: drug susceptibility

IDO:0000468.definition: A susceptibility that inheres in an organism and is the degree to which it can be harmed by an infectious agent.
IDO:0000468.label: susceptibility to infectious agent

OBI:0100026.definition: A material entity that is an individual living system, such as animal, plant, bacteria or virus, that is capable of replicating or reproducing, growth and maintenance in the right environment. An organism may be unicellular or made up, like humans, of many billions of cells divided into specialized tissues and organs.
OBI:0100026.label: organism

IDO:0000461.definition: An organism that has two infections with distinct Species of infectious agents.
IDO:0000461.label: co-infected organism

IDO:0000460.definition: An organism that has an infection in or on its extended organism.
IDO:0000460.label: infected organism

IDO:0000463.definition: A quality that inheres in an infectious agent and is the likelihood that the infectious agent will undergo a horizontal transmission process.
IDO:0000463.label: infectious agent transmissibility

IDO:0000464.definition: A quality that inheres in an infectious agent and is the liklihood that the infectious disposition will be realized upon exposure of a susceptible organism.
IDO:0000464.label: infectivity

IDO:0000467.definition: A quality that inheres in an entity and is the degree to which it can be harmed by another entity.
IDO:0000467.label: susceptibility

IDO:0000466.definition: A quality that inheres in an infectious agent and is the degree to which realizations of the infectious disease caused by the infectious agent become severe or fatal.
IDO:0000466.label: virulence

IDO:0000502.definition: A process of infectious disease realizations and for which there is a statistically significant increase in the infectious disease incidence of a population.
IDO:0000502.label: infectious disease epidemic

IDO:0000503.definition: A process in which multiple infectious disease epidemics of the same type of infectious disease unfold over overlapping periods of time and affect organism populations located in different geographic regions, including different countries and continents.
IDO:0000503.label: infectious disease pandemic

IDO:0000500.definition: An active immunization that begins with exposure to smallpox in the form of a scab from a pustule and results in immunity against smallpox.
IDO:0000500.label: variolation

IDO:0000501.definition: An immunization that begins with transfer to an organism of molecules not produced by that organism and that confer immunity against an infectious agent.
IDO:0000501.label: passive immunization against infectious agent

IDO:0000506.definition: An infection that has as part bacteria located in the blood.
IDO:0000506.label: bacteremia

IDO:0000507.definition: A bacteremia in which the baceteria are replicating.
IDO:0000507.label: _obsolete_septicemia

IDO:0000504.definition: An infection that is clinically abnormal.
IDO:0000504.label: infectious disorder

IDO:0000505.definition: An infection that has as part virus particles located in the blood.
IDO:0000505.label: viremia

IDO:0000663.definition: Any process that stops, prevents, or reduces the frequency, rate or extent of a life-sustaining process.
IDO:0000663.label: negative regulation of life-sustaining process

IDO:0000662.definition: A process which is necessary for the survival of an organism.
IDO:0000662.label: life-sustaining process

IDO:0000508.definition: A virus that is in its assembled state consisting of genomic material (DNA or RNA) surrounded by coating molecules.
IDO:0000508.label: virion

IDO:0000509.definition: An aggregate of organisms of the same Species.
IDO:0000509.label: organism population

IDO:0000667.definition: A disposition to participate in a process of symbiosis in which the bearer derives a growth, survival, or fitness advantage from symbiosis while the other symbiont's growth, survival, or fitness is reduced.
IDO:0000667.label: parasitic disposition

IDO:0000666.definition: A disposition to initiate processes that result in a disorder in a human organism.
IDO:0000666.label: human pathogenicity disposition

IDO:0000665.definition: A material entity bearing a source of infection role.
IDO:0000665.label: source of infection

GO:0032502.definition: A biological process whose specific outcome is the progression of an integrated living unit: an anatomical structure (which may be a subcellular structure, cell, tissue, or organ), or organism over time from an initial condition to a later condition.
GO:0032502.label: developmental process

GO:0050777.definition: Any process that stops, prevents, or reduces the frequency, rate or extent of the immune response, the immunological reaction of an organism to an immunogenic stimulus.
GO:0050777.label: negative regulation of immune response

IDO:0000593.definition: A continuous temporal interval during which a transmission process occurs.
IDO:0000593.label: transmission period

IDO:0000221.definition: 'the unfolding or course of infectious diseasennwhat do we say about infectious disease that always remain latent nwhat about when a pathogen continues its progression nnwe need to think about whether we need a term called stagenlife cycle?nprogression?ndevelopment?'-ID[O]:0000221: the unfolding or course of infectious diseasennwhat do we say about infectious disease that always remain latent nwhat about when a pathogen continues its progression nnwe need to think about whether we need a term called stagenlife cycle?nprogression?ndevelopment?
IDO:0000221.label: _obsolete_infectious disease progression

IDO:0000592.definition: An organism population whose members have acquired immunity to an infectious agent.
IDO:0000592.label: immune population

IDO:0000227.definition: 'is a period a process?'-ID[O]:0000227: is a period a process?
IDO:0000227.label: _obsolete_dormancy period

IDO:0000226.definition: 'is this just the part of the life cycle of the biotic entity that has role pathogen for the period of time while it has role pathogen?nncan include phases in the existence of the entity before it becomes a pathogen'-ID[O]:0000226: is this just the part of the life cycle of the biotic entity that has role pathogen for the period of time while it has role pathogen?nncan include phases in the existence of the entity before it becomes a pathogen
IDO:0000226.label: _obsolete_pathogen life cycle

IDO:0000614.definition: A biological material entity that is capable of replication.
IDO:0000614.label: _obsolete_replicating biological material entity

IDO:0000612.definition: An immunosuppression process which arises as the result of a disorder.
IDO:0000612.label: pathologic immunosuppression

IAO:0000102.definition: data about an ontology part is a data item about a part of an ontology, for example a term
IAO:0000102.label: data about an ontology part

IDO:0000430.definition: A role borne by an anatomical entity in virtue of the fact that it serves as the site through which an infectious agent enters a host.
IDO:0000430.label: infectious agent portal of entry role

IDO:0000009.definition: 'infection has occurred, but it might not have manifested itselfnquality of being in a non replicative statentime to manifest itself na pathogen when it is in a non replicative state'-ID[O]:0000009: infection has occurred, but it might not have manifested itselfnquality of being in a non replicative statentime to manifest itself na pathogen when it is in a non replicative state
IDO:0000009.label: _obsolete_latency

IDO:0000004.definition: 'the degree of pathogenicitynnpathogenicity and virulence are used in some communities as synonyms.'-ID[O]:0000004: the degree of pathogenicitynnpathogenicity and virulence are used in some communities as synonyms.
IDO:0000004.label: _obsolete_virulence

TRANS:0000000.definition: A process that is the means during which the pathogen is transmitted directly or indirectly from its natural reservoir, a susceptible host or source to a new host.
TRANS:0000000.label: transmission process

TRANS:0000002.definition: Indirect transmission is a transmission process during which the pathogen is indirectly transferred from a reservoir, source or host to another host by intermediary vehicles, vectors or as airborne dust particles.
TRANS:0000002.label: indirect

IDO:0000498.definition: An immunization that begins with exposure of an organism to antigen and results in immunity against an infectious agent.
IDO:0000498.label: active immunization against infectious agent

GO:0044409.definition: Penetration by an organism into the body, tissues, or cells of the host organism. The host is defined as the larger of the organisms involved in a symbiotic interaction.
GO:0044409.label: entry into host

IDO:0000499.definition: An active immunization that begins with exposure of an organism to a vaccine.
IDO:0000499.label: vaccination against infectious agent

IDO:0000092.label: _obsolete_damaging host cells and tissues in subepithelial space

IDO:0000098.definition: 'comment about the instances:nncollections of etiologically connected cases of infectious disease in a given population'-ID[O]:0000098: comment about the instances:nncollections of etiologically connected cases of infectious disease in a given population
IDO:0000098.label: _obsolete_infectious disease

IDO:0000548.definition: A biological macromolecule that has an invasion disposition.
IDO:0000548.label: invasion factor

IDO:0000549.definition: A molecular entity that has a toxin disposition.
IDO:0000549.label: toxin

IDO:0000546.definition: A material entity bearing an end reservoir of infectious agent role.
IDO:0000546.label: _obsolete_end reservoir of infectious agent

IDO:0000547.definition: A biological macromolecule produced by a pathogen and that has a virulence factor disposition.
IDO:0000547.label: virulence factor

IDO:0000544.definition: A material entity bearing a fomite role.
IDO:0000544.label: fomite

IDO:0000545.definition: A material entity bearing an infectious agent reservoir role.
IDO:0000545.label: infectious agent reservoir

IDO:0000542.definition: An infectious agent vector bearing a biological vector of infectious agent role.
IDO:0000542.label: biological vector of infectious agent

IDO:0000543.definition: A material entity bearing an infectious agent vehicle role.
IDO:0000543.label: vehicle of infectious agent

IDO:0000540.definition: An organism bearing an infectious agent vector role.
IDO:0000540.label: infectious agent vector

IDO:0000541.definition: An infectious agent vector bearing a mechanical vector of infectious agent role.
IDO:0000541.label: mechanical vector of infectious agent

IDO:0000627.definition: An infectious disorder that is the physical basis for an unfolding acute infectious disease course.
IDO:0000627.label: acute infection

IDO:0000626.definition: A process by which a disorder comes into existence.
IDO:0000626.label: appearance of disorder

IDO:0000625.definition: An establishment of localization process in which a material entity reaches a site in an organism in which it can survive, grow, multiply, or mature.
IDO:0000625.label: establishment of localization in host

IDO:0000624.definition: A generically dependent continuant that is the set of organism types whose instances have as one of their canonical dispositions, the disposition to bear the host role for a colony of a certain type.
IDO:0000624.label: _obsolete_host range

IDO:0000623.definition: An infectious disposition to be transmitted directly from one organism to another of the same Species by horizontal transmission.
IDO:0000623.label: communicability

IDO:0000622.definition: A disposition to colonize an organism and participate in mutualism or commensalism with that organism.
IDO:0000622.label: disposition to form a non-parasitic colony

IDO:0000621.synonyms: adaptive immunity to infectious agent;immune memory
IDO:0000621.definition: An immunity to infectious agent that inheres in an organism in virtue of antigen receptors encoded by somatically diversified genes in the organism's genome and expressed by cells that have undergone selection during a primary immune response in that organism.
IDO:0000621.label: acquired immunity to infectious agent

GO:0044411.definition: Penetration by an organism into its host organism via active breaching of the physical barriers of the host organism. The host is defined as the larger of the organisms involved in a symbiotic interaction.
GO:0044411.label: entry into host through host barriers

IDO:0000629.definition: A role borne by an organism in virtue of the fact that it's extended organism contains a material entity other than the organism.
IDO:0000629.label: host role

IDO:0000628.definition: An infection that persists for an extended period of time.
IDO:0000628.label: chronic infection

BFO:0000015.definition: p is a process = Def. p is an occurrent that has temporal proper parts and for some time t, p s-depends_on some material entity at t. (axiom label in BFO2 Reference: [083-003])
BFO:0000015.label: process

BFO:0000017.definition: A specifically dependent continuant  that inheres in continuant  entities and are not exhibited in full at every time in which it inheres in an entity or group of entities. The exhibition or actualization of a realizable entity is a particular manifestation, functioning or process that occurs under certain circumstances.
BFO:0000017.label: realizable entity

IDO:0000432.definition: A role borne by a material entity in virtue of the fact that it has an antimicrobial disposition and is applied to a non-living entity.
IDO:0000432.label: disinfectant role

IDO:0000433.definition: A role borne by a material entity in virtue of the fact that it has an antimicrobial disposition and is applied to an anatomical entity of a living organism.
IDO:0000433.label: antiseptic role

IDO:0000539.definition: An organism bearing the infectious agent carrier role.
IDO:0000539.label: infectious agent carrier

IDO:0000431.definition: A role borne by an anatomical entity in virtue of the fact that it serves as the site through which an infectious agent exits a host.
IDO:0000431.label: infectious agent portal of exit role

IDO:0000436.definition: A disease whose physical basis is an infectious disorder.
IDO:0000436.label: infectious disease

IDO:0000437.definition: A disposition borne by a biological macromolecule that is the disposition to participate in adherence to a host.
IDO:0000437.label: adhesion disposition

IDO:0000434.definition: A role borne by an infectious disorder in virtue of the fact that (1) the host has at least two distinct infectious disorders, where neither arose from the other through metastasis, (2) at the time the infectious disorder was established in the host, the host had no infectious disorder, and (3) the infectious disorder increases the host's susceptibility to infectious disorders.
IDO:0000434.label: primary infection role

IDO:0000435.definition: A role borne by an infectious disorder in virtue of the fact that (1) the host has at least two distinct infectious disorders, where neither arose from the other through metastasis, (2) at the time the infectious disorder was established in the host, the host had a primary infectious disorder, and (3) establishment of the infectious disorder occurs because of increased susceptibility to infectious disorders conferred by the primary infectious disorder.
IDO:0000435.label: secondary infection role

IDO:0000533.definition: A organism bearing an intermediate host role.
IDO:0000533.label: intermediate host

IDO:0000532.definition: An organism bearing a definitive host role.
IDO:0000532.label: definitive host

IDO:0000438.definition: A disposition borne by a biological macromolecule that is the disposition to facilitate breach of host epithelial barriers or entry into and survival in host cells.
IDO:0000438.label: invasion disposition

IDO:0000439.definition: A disposition to kill or inhibit the development or reproduction of microorganisms.
IDO:0000439.label: antimicrobial disposition

IDO:0000537.definition: An organism bearing an infectious agent host role.
IDO:0000537.label: infectious agent host

IDO:0000536.definition: An organism bearing a parasite host role.
IDO:0000536.label: parasite host

IDO:0000535.definition: An organism bearing a dead-end host role.
IDO:0000535.label: dead-end host

IDO:0000534.definition: An organism bearing a paratenic host role.
IDO:0000534.label: paratenic host

IDO:0000538.definition: An organism bearing a pathogen host role.
IDO:0000538.label: pathogen host

GO:0065007.definition: Any process that modulates a measurable attribute of any biological process, quality or function.
GO:0065007.label: biological regulation

GO:0008150.definition: Any process specifically pertinent to the functioning of integrated living units: cells, tissues, organs, and organisms. A process is a collection of molecular events with a defined beginning and end.
GO:0008150.label: biological_process

IDO:0000531.definition: An organism bearing a host role.
IDO:0000531.label: host

IDO:0000530.definition: An infectious agent with a primary infectious disposition.
IDO:0000530.label: primary pathogen

IDO:0000054.definition: 'role played by portion of physical substance which promotes colonization'-ID[O]:0000054: role played by portion of physical substance which promotes colonization
IDO:0000054.label: _obsolete_colonization factor

IDO:0000055.definition: 'role played by portion of physical substance utilized by an organism in order to establish adherence to a surface in a host'-ID[O]:0000055: role played by portion of physical substance utilized by an organism in order to establish adherence to a surface in a host
IDO:0000055.label: _obsolete_adhesion factor

IDO:0000059.definition: 'holding place for a potential pathogen...animate or inanimate'-ID[O]:0000059: holding place for a potential pathogen...animate or inanimate
IDO:0000059.label: _obsolete_reservoir

OGMS:0000087.definition: An object aggregate consisting of an organism and all material entities located within the organism, overlapping the organism, or occupying sites formed in part by the organism.
OGMS:0000087.label: extended organism

IDO:0000588.definition: A collective disposition the realization of which mitigates the damaging effects of some entity on members of the collection.
IDO:0000588.label: collective resistance disposition

IDO:0000589.definition: An organism that has an immunodeficiency.
IDO:0000589.label: immunodeficient organism

IDO:0000582.definition: An organism experiencing a long-term non-progressing infectious disease course.
IDO:0000582.label: long-term non-progressor

IDO:0000583.definition: An infectious agent whose infection incidence is increasing following its first introduction into a new host Species.
IDO:0000583.label: emerging pathogen

IDO:0000580.definition: An immunity to infectious agent that inheres in an organism in virtue of antibodies not produced by that organism.
IDO:0000580.label: passive immunity to infectious agent

IDO:0000581.definition: A resistance to drug that mitigates the damaging effects of an antibiotic.
IDO:0000581.label: antibiotic resistance

IDO:0000586.definition: A part of an extended organism that itself has as part a population of one or more infectious agents and that (1) exists as a result of processes initiated by members of the infectious agent population and is (2) clinically abnormal in virtue of the presence of this infectious agent population, or (3) has a disposition to bring clinical abnormality to immunocompetent organisms of the same Species as the host (the organism corresponding to the extended organism) through transmission of a member or offspring of a member of the infectious agent population.
IDO:0000586.label: infection

IDO:0000587.definition: A resistance to infectious agent that inheres in an organism in virtue of a specific allele or combination of alleles in its genome.
IDO:0000587.label: genetic resistance to infectious agent

IDO:0000584.definition: A molecular entity with a toxin disposition, the realization of which damages host cells.
IDO:0000584.label: cytotoxin

IDO:0000585.definition: A collective disposition to initiate processes that result in a disorder.
IDO:0000585.label: collective pathogenic disposition

CHEBI:23367.definition: Any constitutionally or isotopically distinct atom, molecule, ion, ion pair, radical, radical ion, complex, conformer etc., identifiable as a separately distinguishable entity.
CHEBI:23367.label: molecular entity

UBERON:0000178.definition: A fluid that is composed of blood plasma and erythrocytes.
UBERON:0000178.label: blood

IDO:0000490.definition: A quality that inheres in an organism population in virtue of the fact that infections of the type that causes an infectious disease are maintained in the population via intra-population transmission or by transmission from a local reservoir.
IDO:0000490.label: infectious disease endemicity

IDO:0000558.definition: A material entity with an antimicrobial disposition.
IDO:0000558.label: antimicrobial

GO:0051093.definition: Any process that stops, prevents or reduces the rate or extent of development, the biological process whose specific outcome is the progression of an organism over time from an initial condition (e.g. a zygote, or a young adult) to a later condition (e.g. a multicellular animal or an aged adult).
GO:0051093.label: negative regulation of developmental process

IDO:0000306.definition: 'is a quality relating to both bacteria and host'-ID[O]:0000306: is a quality relating to both bacteria and host
IDO:0000306.label: _obsolete_fitness

IDO:0000478.definition: A quality that inheres in an infection in virtue of the fact that the infection persists for an extended period of time.
IDO:0000478.label: _obsolete_chronic quality of infection

IDO:0000479.definition: A quality that inheres in an organism population and is the number of realizations of an infectious disease for which the infectious disease course begins during a specified period of time.
IDO:0000479.label: infectious disease incidence

IDO:0000476.definition: A local infection for which symptoms are observed in parts of the host's extended organism that are distant from the infection.
IDO:0000476.label: focal infection

IDO:0000477.definition: An infectious disease course that begins soon after infection is established and progresses rapidly to severe stages.
IDO:0000477.label: acute infectious disease course

IDO:0000474.definition: An infection for which the infectious agents that are part of the infection are distributed throughout the host.
IDO:0000474.label: systemic infection

IDO:0000475.definition: An infection for which the infectious agents that are part of the infection are limited to a relatively small area of the host's body.
IDO:0000475.label: local infection

IDO:0000472.definition: An infection for which the infectious agents that are part of the infection persist in the extracellular space of the host.
IDO:0000472.label: extracellular infection

IDO:0000473.definition: An infection for which the infectious agents that are part of the infection persist inside host cells.
IDO:0000473.label: intracellular infection

IDO:0000470.definition: A drug susceptibility that inheres in an infectious agent and is the degree to which the infectious agent can be harmed or inhibited from surviving by a drug.
IDO:0000470.label: drug susceptibility of infectious agent

IDO:0000471.definition: An infection comprised of infectious organisms from different Species.
IDO:0000471.label: complex infection

IDO:0000577.definition: An immunity to infectious agent realized in an adaptive immune response.
IDO:0000577.label: _obsolete_adaptive immunity to infectious agent

IDO:0000576.definition: An immunity to infectious agent that inheres in an organism in virtue of germline encoded components that directly recognize components of potential pathogens.
IDO:0000576.label: innate immunity to infectious agent

IDO:0000573.definition: An organism who is host to an infectious agent and has symptoms of the infectious disease associated with the infectious agent
IDO:0000573.label: symptomatic host of infectious agent

IDO:0000572.definition: An organism who has been bearer of the infectious agent carrier role for an extended period of time.
IDO:0000572.label: chronic carrier of infectious agent

IDO:0000571.definition: A material entity that has a resistance disposition.
IDO:0000571.label: resistant entity

IDO:0000570.definition: An infection that is part of an asymptomatic host.
IDO:0000570.label: subclinical infection

IDO:0000579.definition: An immunity to infectious agent that inheres in an organism in virtue of its leukocytes.
IDO:0000579.label: leukocyte-mediated immunity to infectious agent

IDO:0000578.definition: An immunity to infectious agent that inheres in an organism in virtue of components of its circulating body fluid.
IDO:0000578.label: humoral immunity to infectious agent

IAO:0000078.definition: The curation status of the term. The allowed values come from an enumerated list of predefined terms. See the specification of these instances for more detailed definitions of each enumerated value.
IAO:0000078.label: curation status specification

GO:0040007.definition: The increase in size or mass of an entire organism, a part of an organism or a cell.
GO:0040007.label: growth

BFO:0000040.definition: An independent continuant that is spatially extended whose identity is independent of that of other entities and can be maintained through time.
BFO:0000040.label: material entity

IDO:0000409.definition: A symbiont host role borne by an organism in virtue of the fact that its partner in symbiosis reaches developmental maturity or reproduces sexually in the host.
IDO:0000409.label: definitive host role

IDO:0000408.definition: A host role borne by an organism in virtue of the fact that its extended organism contains a second organism and provides an environment supportive for the survival, growth, maturation, or reproduction of that organism.
IDO:0000408.label: symbiont host role

IDO:0000403.definition: A symbiont role borne by an organism in virtue of the fact that it derives a growth, survival, or fitness advantage from symbiosis while the other symbiont's growth, survival, or fitness is reduced.
IDO:0000403.label: parasite role

IDO:0000402.definition: A symbiont role borne by an organism in virtue of the fact that it derives a growth, survival, or fitness advantage from symbiosis, but the other symbiont is neither advantaged nor disadvantaged.
IDO:0000402.label: commensal role

IDO:0000401.definition: A symbiont role borne by an organism in virtue of the fact that both symbionts derive a growth, survival, or fitness advantage from symbiosis.
IDO:0000401.label: mutualist role

IDO:0000400.definition: A role borne by an organism in symbiosis.
IDO:0000400.label: symbiont role

IDO:0000407.definition: An infectious disposition to become part of a disorder in organisms that have intact defenses.
IDO:0000407.label: primary infectious disposition

IDO:0000406.definition: An infectious disposition to become part of a disorder only in organisms whose defenses are compromised.
IDO:0000406.label: opportunistic infectious disposition

IDO:0000405.definition: A role borne by pathogen in virtue of the fact that it or one of its products is sufficiently close to an organism towards which it has the pathogenic disposition to allow realization of the pathogenic disposition.
IDO:0000405.label: pathogen role

IDO:0000404.definition: A role borne by an infectious agent when contained in a host in which its infectious disposition can be realized.
IDO:0000404.label: infectious agent role

GO:0042101.definition: A protein complex that contains a disulfide-linked heterodimer of T cell receptor (TCR) chains, which are members of the immunoglobulin superfamily, and mediates antigen recognition, ultimately resulting in T cell activation. The TCR heterodimer is associated with the CD3 complex, which consists of the nonpolymorphic polypeptides gamma, delta, epsilon, zeta, and, in some cases, eta (an RNA splice variant of zeta) or Fc epsilon chains.
GO:0042101.label: T cell receptor complex

IDO:0000019.definition: 'total number of cases of a particular disease at a given time in a particular population divided by the number of individuals in that particular populationnnthe burden of a disease in a population'-ID[O]:0000019: total number of cases of a particular disease at a given time in a particular population divided by the number of individuals in that particular populationnnthe burden of a disease in a population
IDO:0000019.label: _obsolete_prevalence

GO:0002443.definition: Any process involved in the carrying out of an immune response by a leukocyte.
GO:0002443.label: leukocyte mediated immunity

GO:0032991.definition: A stable assembly of two or more macromolecules, i.e. proteins, nucleic acids, carbohydrates or lipids, in which at least one component is a protein and the constituent parts function together.
GO:0032991.label: macromolecular complex

GO:0002250.definition: An immune response mediated by cells expressing specific receptors for antigen produced through a somatic diversification process, and allowing for an enhanced secondary response to subsequent exposures to the same antigen (immunological memory).
GO:0002250.label: adaptive immune response
